description: {"blocks":[{"key":"87llf","text":"PURPOSE: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2md3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b69jh","text":"Step-by-step instructions for checking sequence quality for SARS-CoV-2 wastewater samples using SSQuAWK: SARS - CoV - 2 Sequence Quality Assurance Workflow and Kontraption. The SSQuAWK workflow, implemented in a custom Galaxy instance, will produce quality assessments for raw reads (Illumina MiSeq paired-end fastq files).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":96,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":105,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":120,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":137,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":147,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":160,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu6ll","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbkp3","text":"SCOPE: This protocol covers the following tasks:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dkbl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u4c9","text":"1. Set up an account in GalaxyTrakr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aogh5","text":"2. Create a new history","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4jat","text":"3. Upload data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fc3th","text":"4. Execute the SSQuAWK workflow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b90u9","text":"5. Interpret the results","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pd2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fijsj","text":"Version history:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3shc","text":"V1: Basic protocol steps with screenshots","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sflf","text":"V2: Addition of a detailed 12 minute video tutorial","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e56gt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aq47c","text":"Create a GalaxyTrakr account here: https://account.galaxytrakr.org/Account/Register","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":83}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":48}],"data":{}},{"key":"1o4pk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k8et","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agr7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8EAFDA816CF84B7880984A627007DC45","url":"https://account.galaxytrakr.org/Account/Register"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"343565605EA911EAAC84F5250F874054","height":214.05454545454546,"id":197102,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 1.18.17 AM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f89y9yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/garq9yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/garp9yen.webp","width":367.90624999999994}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ec3i1","text":"Create a new history. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"db98d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcvg6","text":"We recommend creating a new history for each new MiSeq sequence set with details and date in the history name. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vg1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i63a","text":"Save your SSQuAWK output here with any other relevant analyses. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54tc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7o0hh","text":"After all the analysis output from this run is saved to your internal data network or computer, older history's should be purged/deleted so as not to occupy the limited storage space in your account. In some cases it may be useful to save, for a limited time, multiple histories or to run analyses concurrently in multiple histories. In these cases you need to pay attention to your % usage bar (shows % used of allocated storage space) in the upper right corner of the GalaxyTrakr page. If you need additional space you can contact galaxytrakrsupport@fda.hhs.gov and request additional storage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":533,"length":30}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"733BD230234411EA9B812F7E353E6819","url":"http://galaxytrakrsupport@fda.hhs.gov"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77diu","text":"Create a new history with the \"+\" symbol in the upper right hand corner. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":101}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2dvu","text":"Upload sequence data to your history, using either of the two options circled in red below.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1748b","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7rjuq","text":"A window will appear in the middle of your screen. This is where you select your files using the \"Choose local files\"  button at the bottom of the window. The \"Choose local files\" button is circled in green. These fastq files should be paired (two per sample).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9oag","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4s6ks","text":"After you've selected your files, press \"Start\" to initiate your data upload to GalaxyTrakr. The \"Start\" button is circled in blue.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d3fb6","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8buhi","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3qli","text":"   ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4d1kk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8F16A1F0629F11ECB1C31F286976DAE5","height":180,"id":197110,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar2bn8q7.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/garybn8q7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/garzbn8q7.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/garxbn8q7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"15k5v","text":"As the file uploads complete, each row will turn green. If samples are shown with yellow background, then are still uploading.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c5nue","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"722ib","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bv2ke","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FC1C06A0629F11ECB1C31F286976DAE5","height":273,"id":197114,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar6bn8q7.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar4bn8q7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar5bn8q7.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar3bn8q7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3gfte","text":"You have just upload a set of forward and reverse reads.  For further analysis these files need to be paired properly so the platform knows which R1 and R2 files go with each sample.  GalaxyTrakr does this by creating a List of Dataset Pairs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":220,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"hiq3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ch5m","text":"Within your newly created History panel, click the \"check box,\" then select all the files you just uploaded by clicking \"All\" or by individually selecting the ones you want to pair.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4k5v5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"270kk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ao43m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5h09g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fm8tt","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"47jj6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3DBDC8A062A011ECB1C31F286976DAE5","height":294,"id":197118,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gasabn8q7.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar8bn8q7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar9bn8q7.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gar7bn8q7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bh1q","text":"Check all the files belonging to a pair. {"blocks":[{"key":"2flr5","text":"This paired dataset will now be available for analysis in your history panel. {"blocks":[{"key":"cqv32","text":" The SSQuAWK output file includes the following metrics:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7la1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1s62b","text":"Parameter Input Description Contigs Assembly Number of contigs in the de-novo SKESA assembly. Contigs smaller than 200 base-pairs (bp) are not counted.  Length Assembly Total length of all contigs \u003e 200bp. This should approximate the size of the genome for the target organism. EstCov Assembly Mean coverage for contigs in the SKESA assembly. N50 Assembly Sequence length of the shortest contig at 50% of the total genome length MedianInsert Read Distance between forward and reverse reads. Calculated by mapping reads to SKESA assembly using bwa. MeanLength_R1 Read Mean length of forward read MeanLength_R2 Read Mean length of reverse read MeanQ_R1 Read Mean Q-score of forward read MeanQ_R2 Read Mean Q-score of reverse read Scheme Assembly PubMLST (pubmlst.org) database scheme (e.g. senterica for Salmonella enterica) ST Assembly Sequence Type  Loci Assembly gene (allele number) – for example aroC(118) ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":153,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":278,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":343,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":429,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":548,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":595,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":642,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":685,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":728,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":823,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":850,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":16,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":886}],"data":[]},{"key":"22tn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_10":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_11":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_12":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_13":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_6":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_7":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_8":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_9":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":["169","81",200],"data":[["\u003cb\u003e\u003ci\u003eParameter\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003e\u003ci\u003eInput\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003e\u003ci\u003eDescription\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/b\u003e"],["\u003cb\u003eSample\u003c/b\u003e","List title: Wastewater QC workflow in GalaxyTrakr (SSQuAWK)
